title: POST /projects/:projectId/app-users/telemetry: include deviceId/appUserId + invalidated status
description:
Update telemetry POST response to include deviceId and appUserId, and return a status that indicates whether the bearer token has been invalidated (revoked/deactivated/expired).

- server/lib/domain/vg-telemetry.js: return deviceId alongside inserted id/received_at so resource can echo it back.
- server/test/integration/api/vg-telemetry.js: assert new response fields/status.
- server/docs/vg_api.md: document response schema.

Follow-ups:
- Run server integration tests once npm deps/network are available.
- Ensure client-side callers handle new fields/status.

{
  "id": 55,
  "appUserId": 123,
  "deviceId": "device-1",
  "dateTime": "2025-12-21T10:02:00.000Z",
  "serverTime": "2025-12-21T10:02:00.500Z",

}

Meaning:
- appUserId: actorId from the field_key session
- deviceId: echoed from request payload
- status=invalidated if bearer token no longer resolves via Sessions.getByBearerToken(token) after processing (revoked/deactivated/expired).

title: Telemetry: accept and store app events (event jsonb)
description:
Extend app-user telemetry so clients can send discrete app events (e.g., device time sync detected, incorrect PIN, token refreshed, logged in/out, app started/closed) as part of POST /projects/:projectId/app-users/telemetry.

Proposed payload change (backwards compatible):
- Add optional "event" attribute to the telemetry JSON payload.
- "event" should be a JSON object (stored as-is) with at least a "type" string, plus optional metadata.
  Example:
  { "event": { "type": "app.started", "occurredAt": "2025-12-21T10:02:00.000Z", "details": { "screen": "Main" } } }

Storage:
- Add "event" column to "vg_app_user_telemetry" as jsonb (nullable).
- Optionally add "event_type" (text) derived from event.type for indexing/filtering (decide during implementation).

Plan:
1) DB migration: add jsonb column (+ optional index)
2) Server: validate/accept event in domain parser and persist
3) Admin listing: include event in GET /system/app-users/telemetry output (and optional filters)
4) Tests: integration tests for storing/returning event
5) Docs: update server/docs/vg_api.md and (optionally) server/docs/api.yaml

Acceptance:
- Existing telemetry payloads still work unchanged.
- When "event" is provided, it is stored and returned in admin telemetry listing.
- Input validation rejects non-object events / missing type / oversized payloads (define limits).

title: App Users Can Read Project Details via GET /v1/projects/{id}
description:
## Summary
Implemented support for app users (field_keys) to read project details via the GET /v1/projects/{id} endpoint.

## Implementation Details

### Changes Made
1. **server/docs/sql/vg_app_user_auth.sql**
   - Added UPDATE statement to grant 'project.read' verb to app-user role
   - Commit: 87a62efd

2. **server/lib/model/query/auth.js** 
   - Added special authorization logic for field_keys (app users)
   - App users can now read a project if they have assignment to any form in that project
   - Maintains security by checking form-level assignments
   - Commit: ebb671bd

### How It Works
- App users are field_keys in the system, not web users
- They have assignments to forms, not projects
- Added special case in can() function that checks:
  1. Actor is a field_key
  2. Requesting project.read permission
  3. Has access to at least one form in the project via form assignments
- This allows Collect app to fetch project metadata while maintaining security

### Testing
- App users can now call: GET /v1/projects/{id}
- Returns project details (name, description, metadata)
- Access is limited to projects they have form access to
